Walkthrough.descriptionThree: All digital identities and credentials are stored locally on your device.

Recovery.subheader: Enter your secret phrase word by word and it will appear here
Recovery.forgotBtn: What if I forgot my phrase?

OnboardingBackup.instruction: Drag the ball into the circle to start

RecoveryInfo.header: What to do if you forgot your secret phrase
RecoveryInfo.textPartOne: Without your secret phrase you will not be able to re-activate your identity.
RecoveryInfo.textPartTwo: Recovering your entire wallet requires both the secret phrase and a backup file.
RecoveryInfo.textPartThree: Are you sure you do not have a copy stored somewhere safe?
RecoveryInfo.textPartFour: Think back to when you first created your identity

Entropy.subheader: Randomly draw untill 100% to secure your identity

SeedphraseWrite.touchInstructions: Hold your finger on the circle
SeedphraseWrite.writeInstructions: Write down the collection of words exactly as shown below. Keep this safe!
SeedphraseWrite.writeInstructionsWarning: You will not be able to view this again

SeedphraseInfo.header: Why these words are important to you
SeedphraseInfo.textOne: Your wallet will store very sensitive data about you. We want to make sure that you keep it safe right from the start.
SeedphraseInfo.textTwoHighlight: Only this unique set of words
SeedphraseInfo.textTwoDefault: can be used to regenerate your identity when your phone is lost or broken.
SeedphraseInfo.textThree: We strongly recommend storing your set of words in a safe place. Writing it down or using an encrypted password manager are the best options.
SeedphraseInfo.textFour: Do not share your secret phrase with anyone.

SeedphraseRepeat.orderInstructions: Drag and drop the words until they are in the correct order
SeedphraseRepeat.matchingError: Check carefully for mistakes and try again

BackupOptions.exportSubheader: Download an encrypted copy of the data in your SmartWallet to your device. Make sure to keep your backups up-to-date and stored somewhere safe
BackupOptions.importSubheader: In case you deleted something important by mistake. Only possible if backup was created using this wallet

FAQ.header_q1: What happens if my phone gets lost or stolen?
FAQ.subheader_q1: You can regain control over your wallet using the secret phrase created during setup of your SmartWallet. This will not recover any documents or other information stored in a wallet on a lost device. In the future, we will offer a backup feature to secure all data to a backup file in order to safeguard the contents of your wallet.
FAQ.header_q2: Who has access to my data?
FAQ.subheader_q2: All your data is stored and managed on your device. You are in full control over who gets access to information. Jolocom has no access to the data on your device nor does anybody else without your permission. If you give another party access to your information, you can always see what you have shared. In fact, you can always quickly and easily check which service has access to which data. This provides you with an instant overview of your connections.
FAQ.header_q3: Are Jolocom identities and the SmartWallet GDPR-compliant?
FAQ.subheader_q3: Emphatically, YES. Jolocom identities, the SmartWallet, and all our products are designed to prioritize the integrity, privacy, and security of user data. The wallet as well as the protocol for creating identities and sharing identity information are fully GDPR-compliant.
FAQ.subheader_q4:
The SmartWallet is an application designed by Jolocom that lets you manage data related to your identity — like your email address, phone number, or ID card.
Your wallet holds documents and other digital contents which you can exchange and share with services at the press of a button.

AusweisLostPin.title: How to restore access to my card?
AusweisLostPin.description: You can not find your PIN letter? You have set a PIN when picking up the ID card or later that you cannot recall now? If this is the case please turn to the competent authority and set a new PIN there.
AusweisLostPin.contact: You can also contact the support by email

AusweisReview.subheader: Choose one or more attributes requested by ${serviceName} to proceed

AusweisPukLock.header: Your card is locked now and you have to introduce the PUK code to unlock it
AusweisPukLock.subtitle: You can always unlock your card by using the “Unlock my card” button in the Identity tab

AusweisIdentity.subheader: This is an early access feature for the German eID (Online-Ausweisfunktion) in the Jolocom SmartWallet. For the time being, it is only available to users of the "Secure Digital Identities" showcase projects.
AusweisIdentity.moreInfoDescription:
SmartWallet allows you to use the German eID function (e.g. with the German electronic residence permit) without having to go through other apps. 

If the German eID function is required during a registration process, the SmartWallet will prompt you to hold your eID card up to the NFC reader on your smartphone and enter your 6-digit eID PIN. You also have the option to specify which data you want to share and to check with whom you share it. In addition, you can change your transport PIN to unlock the eID card, change your eID card PIN and unlock the eID card if necessary.

For the time being, the German eID function is only available to participants of the pilot applications from the research program "Secure Digital Identities" of the federal Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate Action. Furthermore, Jolocom is involved in the ONCE, ID-Ideal and SDIKA projects. The German eID function was implemented on the basis of the AusweisApp2 SDK and uses its existing infrastructure (Online-Ausweisfunktion).

AusweisChangePin.transportPinSubheader: To set up your PIN, you will need to enter the 5 digit transport PIN that came in a letter alongside your ID card.
AusweisChangePin.pinSubheader: If you have already set a 6 digit PIN before, you can change it here.
AusweisChangePin.forgotSubheader: If you forgot your eID PIN or cannot find your transport PIN letter, please turn to the competent authority to set a new PIN. You can also contact the support at:

AusweisPinInfo.description:
For the 6-digit eID PIN, choose a combination of numbers that’s not easy to guess

When changing the PIN for the first time, please use the five-digit Transport PIN. You will find the Transport PIN in the letter you received from your responsible authority (marked in red) after you have applied for your identity card.

Please note that you can not use the online eID function with the five-digit Transport PIN. A change to a 6-digit PIN is mandatory

AusweisScanner.startSubheader: Please do not remove your card until the current step is done

AusweisCanInfo.description: The card access number (CAN) is only required if you have entered the wrong PIN twice already. In order to prevent that a wrong PIN is entered for a third time without your consent, thus blocking your card, you have to enter the CAN at this point. The CAN is a 6-digit number that you can find on the front side of your ID card at the bottom right.

AusweisTransportPin.warning1: Please note that If you already set a six-digit PIN previously, the five-digit Transport PIN is no longer valid
AusweisTransportPin.warning2: You may use the five-digit Transport PIN only once to change your PIN

AusweisTransportPinInfo.description:
You will find the Transport PIN in the letter you received from your responsible authority (marked in red) after you have applied for your identity card. 

Please note that you can not use the online eID function with the five-digit Transport PIN. A change to a six-digit PIN is mandatory

AusweisPukInfo.description:
You will find the PUK number in the letter you received from your responsible authority (marked in red) after you have applied for your identity card. 

Please note that you can not use the online eID function with the five-digit Transport PIN. A change to a six-digit PIN is mandatory

AusweisUnlock.notLockedHeader: System did not detect your card being blocked
AusweisUnlock.pukExhaustedHeader: We didn't manage to unlock your card
